<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/16/what-you-need-to-know-biden-s-stumbling-voting-rights-push?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Voting rights bill stumbles to the finish line
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/16/what-you-need-to-know-biden-s-stumbling-voting-rights-push?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="President Biden speaks to the press " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2e0f5456db63fa520a265ad04c0944394d28d1e2-6000x4000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Kent Nishimura/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Democrats desperately wanted to deliver a major victory on voting rights around Martin Luther King Jr. Day. The reality is, as President Biden <a href="https://apnews.com/article/voting-rights-joe-biden-voting-elections-wv-state-wire-28fce7f5190404f5091158c912bf8d5d?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">conceded</a> last Thursday, “I don’t know whether we can get this done.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Democrats need 60 votes in the Senate to overcome a Republican filibuster, but they only have 50 senators. And a proposal to change filibuster rules so 50 would be sufficient was dismissed by moderate Democrats Kyrsten Sinema and Joe Manchin, who oppose changing Senate rules even while supporting the voting rights bill. So…the odds aren’t looking good for it.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s in the bill?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The 735-page “Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act” would <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2022/01/14/democrats-voting-rights-megabill-left-out-527095?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overhaul</a> how US elections are run and reform other areas of national politics like campaign finance and the gerrymandering of congressional districts. It would also make Election Day a federal holiday in midterm and presidential years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to Dem activists, the need to protect voting rights is increasingly urgent as GOP-led states pass election laws that make it harder to vote, especially for minorities.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A business newsletter has to ask: Where does Corporate America stand?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Large corporations are generally supportive of Democrats’ election reform measures. More than 150 companies, including Amazon and Pepsi, signed a letter last summer endorsing an earlier version of the voting rights legislation. More recently, a group of business leaders including the CEOs of Etsy and Reddit <a href="https://thehill.com/business-a-lobbying/business-a-lobbying/589442-business-executives-urge-senate-to-bypass-filibuster?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urged Dems</a> to change filibuster rules in order to push the legislation through the Senate.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Businesses have also pushed back on GOP attempts to change elections laws in individual states. MLB even moved the 2021 All-Star Game out of Atlanta after Georgia introduced new voting rules.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said the Senate will take up the voting rights bill, which has already passed the majority-Democrat House, tomorrow. A failure to get it done would be a big setback for Biden’s agenda.</p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/16/tonga-facing-significant-damage-from-undersea-volcano-eruption?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
So this happened
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/16/tonga-facing-significant-damage-from-undersea-volcano-eruption?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="So this happened " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=461 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-16/image-49d00393b5069a9b06fc55c1ddbb5bdcd1d551b7-480x330-gif/giphy(6).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="So this happened " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-01-16/image-49d00393b5069a9b06fc55c1ddbb5bdcd1d551b7-480x330-gif/giphy(6).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>CIRA via the Twitter account @US_StormWatch</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An underwater volcano <a href="https://apnews.com/article/environment-and-nature-new-zealand-tsunamis-volcanic-eruptions-tonga-c2ffa1bb2ab6a2a3c7b85a875c96a9c7?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">erupted</a> in the Pacific Ocean on Saturday, raining ash on the nearby nation of Tonga and prompting tsunami advisories from Japan to California.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The geologic details: </strong>This eruption was huge—equivalent to a magnitude 5.8 earthquake, according to the US Geological Survey. It released a plume of ash thousands of feet in the air, and generated a sonic boom that could be heard nearly 6,000 miles away in Alaska.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tsunamis, which are caused by the sudden displacement of a large amount of water, are primarily caused by earthquakes, not undersea volcanoes.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The eruption's effect on New Zealand and the West Coast of the US was limited but due to the ash, Tonga looks “<a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-60009944?xtor=AL-72-[partner]-[bbc.news.twitter]-[headline]-[news]-[bizdev]-[isapi]&at_custom4=C01FD8C2-76D4-11EC-B8E6-30ED4744363C&at_medium=custom7&at_campaign=64&at_custom1=[post+type]&at_custom2=twitter&at_custom3=%40BBCWorld" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">like a moonscape</a>,” locals told the BBC. While no deaths have been reported there, the damage to Tonga is “significant,” New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern said, and knocked-out communication and internet lines have made it difficult to reach some of the nation’s 105,000 residents.</p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/16/world-s-first-nft-restaurant-is-coming-to-manhattan-next-year?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">

</font>
</a>
</h1>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/16/world-s-first-nft-restaurant-is-coming-to-manhattan-next-year?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="illustrations of sushi " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4e2687578445b0e30ca98a916e9a3f806a715cef-1024x1024.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Flyfish Club </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The one knock on New York City’s food scene is that it’s lacking good NFT fare. But a new venture from entrepreneur Gary Vaynerchuk is trying to change that.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Flyfish Club announced it’s <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/food/2022/01/15/nft-restaurant-flyfish-new-york/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coming to Manhattan</a> early next year as the world’s “first NFT restaurant.” How does it work? You need to be an owner of a Flyfish digital token to partake of the “globally inspired” seafood menu; and another, more exclusive token will get you into a special omakase room.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Flyfish has sold 1,501 tokens this month to raise around $15 million for the venture.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The NFTs originally went for 2.5 ETH each, or around $8,300, but on the </span><span><a href="https://opensea.io/collection/flyfish-club?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">secondary market</a></span><span> they’re trading for 6.63 ETH ($22,000) minimum.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Sure, an NFT restaurant sounds goofy, but if you think of it more as a social club, like Soho House, it makes a little more sense. Flyfish is betting that people will buy its tokens as a way to signal their social status, similar to a luxury watch or vehicle. If it’s at least a little bit successful, expect more NFT restaurants to follow.</p>
</div>

<img alt="Ship stuck in Suez Canal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/6026459fbdef1caa2689791d21081405b26a7adb-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Mahmoud Khaled/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Despite that temporary blockage last February, a record <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-16/record-ships-sailed-suez-canal-in-2021-despite-ever-given-saga?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20,694 ships</a> passed through the Suez Canal in 2021, generating $6.3 billion in fees. Traffic is only expected to increase this year, and so is the canal’s revenue—a 6% toll hike will go into effect in February.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“You people are just vectors of disease to me, and I don’t want to be anywhere near you.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ferris State University professor Barry Mehler has been <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/01/16/us/barry-mehler-coronavirus.html?smid=tw-nytimes&smtyp=cur" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">suspended</a> after giving students an…unorthodox introduction to his course. Mehler told the AP that his 14-minute, profanity-filled rant over Zoom was just a humorous attempt “to get their juices flowing.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Buy things, not experiences. (<a href="https://write.as/harold-lee/theres-a-phrase-going-around-that-you-should-buy-experiences-not-things?pk_campaign=rss-feed" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Harold Lee</a>)</p>
</div>

<img alt="Novak Djokovic" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7fd7d90109f8e89381f9b447e5c01a77d266b5f1-5126x3429.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Australian Open gets underway: </strong>Novak Djokovic’s quest for a record 21st major championship will have to wait after the unvaccinated tennis star was sent packing from Australia. But let’s not allow this soap opera to overshadow the actual tournament, which began today in Melbourne.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>Goldman Sachs, Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, Netflix, Procter & Gamble, and United Airlines headline the second week of Q4 earnings season.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">5G goes live: </strong>Verizon will <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-04/verizon-is-launching-5g-service-after-two-week-faa-sought-delay?cmpid=BBD011522_WKND&utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=220115&utm_campaign=weekendreading" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">switch on</a> its 5G “ultra wideband” service in 46 metro areas on Wednesday after delaying the launch for two weeks in a compromise with the aviation industry. The FAA and airlines have warned the service will interfere with airplane software.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>US households can order four free rapid Covid tests from a </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-households-can-order-4-free-covid-19-tests-starting-jan-19-white-house-2022-01-14/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">government website </a></span><span>beginning Wednesday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Betty White would have turned 100 today.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><em>Ozark </em></span><span>season 4 arrives on Friday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Sundance Film Festival kicks off on Thursday (it’s virtual, and you can </span><span><a href="https://festival.sundance.org/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buy tickets here</a></span><span>).</span>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nVoting rights bill stumbles to the finish line\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/01/16/what-you-need-to-know-biden-s-stumbling-voting-rights-push?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"President Biden speaks to the press \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2e0f5456db63fa520a265ad04c0944394d28d1e2-6000x4000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eKent Nishimura/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDemocrats desperately wanted to deliver a major victory on voting rights around Martin Luther King Jr. Day. The reality is, as President Biden \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/voting-rights-joe-biden-voting-elections-wv-state-wire-28fce7f5190404f5091158c912bf8d5d?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econceded\u003c/a\u003e last Thursday, “I don’t know whether we can get this done.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDemocrats need 60 votes in the Senate to overcome a Republican filibuster, but they only have 50 senators. And a proposal to change filibuster rules so 50 would be sufficient was dismissed by moderate Democrats Kyrsten Sinema and Joe Manchin, who oppose changing Senate rules even while supporting the voting rights bill. So…the odds aren’t looking good for it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s in the bill?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe 735-page “Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act” would \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2022/01/14/democrats-voting-rights-megabill-left-out-527095?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoverhaul\u003c/a\u003e how US elections are run and reform other areas of national politics like campaign finance and the gerrymandering of congressional districts. It would also make Election Day a federal holiday in midterm and presidential years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to Dem activists, the need to protect voting rights is increasingly urgent as GOP-led states pass election laws that make it harder to vote, especially for minorities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA business newsletter has to ask: Where does Corporate America stand?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLarge corporations are generally supportive of Democrats’ election reform measures. More than 150 companies, including Amazon and Pepsi, signed a letter last summer endorsing an earlier version of the voting rights legislation. More recently, a group of business leaders including the CEOs of Etsy and Reddit \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/business-a-lobbying/business-a-lobbying/589442-business-executives-urge-senate-to-bypass-filibuster?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eurged Dems\u003c/a\u003e to change filibuster rules in order to push the legislation through the Senate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBusinesses have also pushed back on GOP attempts to change elections laws in individual states. MLB even moved the 2021 All-Star Game out of Atlanta after Georgia introduced new voting rules.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003eSenate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said the Senate will take up the voting rights bill, which has already passed the majority-Democrat House, tomorrow. A failure to get it done would be a big setback for Biden’s agenda.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" href=\"https://apnews.com/article/environment-and-nature-new-zealand-tsunamis-volcanic-eruptions-tonga-c2ffa1bb2ab6a2a3c7b85a875c96a9c7?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eerupted\u003c/a\u003e in the Pacific Ocean on Saturday, raining ash on the nearby nation of Tonga and prompting tsunami advisories from Japan to California.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe geologic details: \u003c/strong\u003eThis eruption was huge—equivalent to a magnitude 5.8 earthquake, according to the US Geological Survey. It released a plume of ash thousands of feet in the air, and generated a sonic boom that could be heard nearly 6,000 miles away in Alaska.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTsunamis, which are caused by the sudden displacement of a large amount of water, are primarily caused by earthquakes, not undersea volcanoes.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe eruption's effect on New Zealand and the West Coast of the US was limited but due to the ash, Tonga looks “\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-60009944?xtor=AL-72-[partner]-[bbc.news.twitter]-[headline]-[news]-[bizdev]-[isapi]\u0026at_custom4=C01FD8C2-76D4-11EC-B8E6-30ED4744363C\u0026at_medium=custom7\u0026at_campaign=64\u0026at_custom1=[post+type]\u0026at_custom2=twitter\u0026at_custom3=%40BBCWorld\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elike a moonscape\u003c/a\u003e,” locals told the BBC. While no deaths have been reported there, the damage to Tonga is “significant,” New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern said, and knocked-out communication and internet lines have made it difficult to reach some of the nation’s 105,000 residents.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe one knock on New York City’s food scene is that it’s lacking good NFT fare. But a new venture from entrepreneur Gary Vaynerchuk is trying to change that.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFlyfish Club announced it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/food/2022/01/15/nft-restaurant-flyfish-new-york/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecoming to Manhattan\u003c/a\u003e early next year as the world’s “first NFT restaurant.” How does it work? You need to be an owner of a Flyfish digital token to partake of the “globally inspired” seafood menu; and another, more exclusive token will get you into a special omakase room.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFlyfish has sold 1,501 tokens this month to raise around $15 million for the venture.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe NFTs originally went for 2.5 ETH each, or around $8,300, but on the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://opensea.io/collection/flyfish-club?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecondary market\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e they’re trading for 6.63 ETH ($22,000) minimum.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eSure, an NFT restaurant sounds goofy, but if you think of it more as a social club, like Soho House, it makes a little more sense. Flyfish is betting that people will buy its tokens as a way to signal their social status, similar to a luxury watch or vehicle. If it’s at least a little bit successful, expect more NFT restaurants to follow.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
